Posts.Content: Have you been treated for DCIS (Ductal Carcinoma In Situ)?    If you are a District resident and have been treated for DCIS (sometimes called “Stage 0” breast cancer” or “non-invasive breast cancer”) in 2009 or 2010, the Cancer Prevention and Treatment Fund needs your advice!  You can help other women with this kind of breast cancer and receive a $15 gift card. All you have to do is call (202) 223-4000 and speak to Judith or Brandel at the Cancer Prevention and Treatment Fund. They will ask you a few questions about your experience with DCIS. $15 for 15 minutes of your time! Call the Cancer Prevention and Treatment Fund: (202) 223-4000. After the phone interview, you will be invited to participate in a focus group to look at a booklet for patients with DCIS and give your opinion. You will be paid $75 for participating in a focus group. The DCIS project of the Cancer Prevention and Treatment Fund is funded, in whole or in part, by a grant from the DC Cancer Consortium through the Department of Health, Government of the District of Columbia.
Posts.Title: Washington, DC Women with DCIS
